Understate: The claim may understate the extent to which the United States is behind many European countries in terms of the ability of every child to get ahead.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support to fully substantiate the assertion that the United States is behind many European countries.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that being "behind" other countries in terms of the ability of every child to get ahead is inherently negative, without providing a clear basis for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the differences in ability for every child to get ahead between the United States and European countries.
